defaultRecipes.title: Chicken Pot Pie
defaultRecipes.description: A comforting chicken pot pie with tender chicken, carrots, peas and celery in a creamy sauce, topped with a flaky crust.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Combine chicken, carrots, peas and celery in a saucepan; add water to cover, boil 15 minutes then drain.
3. In another saucepan melt butter, cook onion until translucent (5-7 min). Stir in flour, salt, pepper and celery seed.
4. Gradually stir in chicken broth and milk, then simmer 5-10 minutes until thickened.
5. Place chicken and vegetable mixture into bottom pie crust; pour in broth mixture.
6. Cover with top crust, seal edges, cut slits in top to allow steam escape.
7. Bake 30-35 minutes or until pastry is golden and filling is bubbly. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

defaultRecipes.title: Chicken Katsu Curry
defaultRecipes.description: Crispy panko chicken cutlet with Japanese curry over rice.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Season chicken, dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat in panko.
2. Shallow-fry in 350°F (175°C) oil until golden and cooked through; drain on rack.
3. For curry: sauté onion, carrot, and potato in a little oil until aromatic.
4. Add chicken stock, simmer until vegetables are tender.
5. Stir in curry roux blocks to thicken; simmer 5 minutes.
6. Slice katsu, plate over steamed rice, ladle curry over the top.

defaultRecipes.title: Beef Wellington
defaultRecipes.description: Tenderloin wrapped with mushroom duxelles, prosciutto, puff pastry.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Sear seasoned tenderloin in hot pan to brown; cool, then brush with Dijon.
2. Chop mushrooms, shallots, garlic; cook down with butter and thyme until dry (duxelles); cool.
3. On plastic wrap, lay prosciutto slices overlapping, spread duxelles on top.
4. Place tenderloin on duxelles, roll tightly in prosciutto; chill 15–20 min.
5. Wrap in puff pastry, seal, brush with egg wash; score decoratively.
6. Bake at 400°F (205°C) until pastry is golden and center reads 125–130°F (52–54°C) for medium-rare; rest 10–15 min before slicing.

defaultRecipes.title: Chicken Enchiladas
defaultRecipes.description: Tortillas filled with shredded chicken, topped with enchilada sauce and cheese.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly oil a 9x13 pan.
2. Mix shredded chicken with a bit of enchilada sauce, onion, cumin, and chili powder.
3. Warm tortillas until pliable; fill with chicken mixture and a little cheese; roll and place seam-side down.
4. Pour remaining sauce over, top with cheese.
5. Bake 20–25 minutes until bubbly; rest 5 minutes, garnish with cilantro and optional sour cream.

defaultRecipes.title: Spring Rolls
defaultRecipes.description: Crispy rolls with pork, shrimp, and veggies; serve with nuoc cham.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Soak glass noodles until softened; drain and cut.
2. Mix ground pork with minced garlic, fish sauce, shredded cabbage, carrot, chopped shrimp, and noodles.
3. Place mixture on wrapper, roll tightly, sealing edges.
4. Fry at 350°F (175°C) until golden and crisp; drain.
5. Serve hot with nuoc cham dipping sauce.

defaultRecipes.title: Loco Moco
defaultRecipes.description: Beef patty over rice, brown gravy, sunny-side egg.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Form seasoned beef patties; sear both sides until cooked to preference; keep warm.
2. In same pan, melt butter; add sliced onion and cook until soft.
3. Stir in flour to make a roux; cook 1–2 minutes.
4. Whisk in beef stock gradually; simmer until thick gravy forms; season to taste.
5. Fry eggs sunny-side up.
6. Serve steamed rice topped with patty, gravy, and egg.

defaultRecipes.title: Garlic Shrimp
defaultRecipes.description: Garlicky butter shrimp with rice and lemon.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Pat shrimp dry; season lightly with salt, pepper, and paprika.
2. Melt butter with a little olive oil; add minced garlic, cook fragrant (30–60 sec).
3. Add shrimp; sauté 2–3 minutes per side until pink and opaque.
4. Finish with lemon juice; adjust seasoning.
5. Serve immediately over rice with extra lemon.

defaultRecipes.title: Pad Thai
defaultRecipes.description: Stir-fried rice noodles with tamarind sauce, egg, tofu/shrimp, peanuts.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Soak rice noodles in warm water until pliable; drain.
2. Mix tamarind, fish sauce, and palm sugar to make sauce.
3. Stir-fry tofu/shrimp briefly; push aside, scramble eggs.
4. Add noodles and sauce; toss until coated and just tender.
5. Add bean sprouts; toss 30–60 sec.
6. Plate with crushed peanuts and lime wedges.

defaultRecipes.title: Margherita Pizza
defaultRecipes.description: Tomato, mozzarella, basil on thin crust.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven with stone/steel to 500–550°F (260–290°C).
2. Stretch dough thin; spread crushed San Marzano tomatoes lightly.
3. Top with sliced mozzarella; drizzle olive oil; salt lightly.
4. Bake 6–8 minutes until crust is blistered and cheese melted.
5. Add fresh basil leaves after baking; slice and serve.

defaultRecipes.title: Butter Chicken
defaultRecipes.description: Creamy tomato-butter sauce with spiced chicken.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Marinate chicken in yogurt, garam masala, garlic, and ginger 30+ minutes.
2. Sear chicken until lightly browned; set aside.
3. In same pan, add butter and tomato puree; simmer with spices.
4. Return chicken; simmer until cooked through.
5. Stir in cream; adjust salt and garam masala; simmer briefly.
6. Serve with rice or naan.

defaultRecipes.title: Shakshuka
defaultRecipes.description: Eggs poached in spicy tomato-pepper sauce.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Sauté onion and bell pepper in olive oil until soft; add garlic.
2. Stir in paprika and cumin; cook briefly.
3. Add crushed tomatoes; simmer 10 minutes to thicken; season.
4. Make wells; crack eggs into wells.
5. Cover and cook until whites set and yolks are still runny.
6. Serve with herbs and crusty bread if desired.

defaultRecipes.title: Bibimbap
defaultRecipes.description: Mixed rice bowl with veggies, beef, egg, and gochujang.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Cook rice; keep warm.
2. Sauté vegetables separately with a little oil and salt: spinach, sprouts, carrot, mushrooms.
3. Cook sliced beef with soy, sugar, garlic; set aside.
4. Fry eggs sunny-side up.
5. Arrange rice in bowls; top with veggies, beef, and egg.
6. Serve with gochujang and a drizzle of sesame oil; mix before eating.

defaultRecipes.title: Grilled Cheese
defaultRecipes.description: Classic buttery grilled cheese sandwich with a perfectly crisp golden crust and melty cheese center.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Heat a skillet over medium-low heat.
2. Butter one side of each bread slice evenly.
3. Place one slice, buttered side down, on the skillet; add cheese slices on top.
4. Top with the second slice of bread, buttered side up.
5. Cook slowly 2–3 minutes per side, pressing gently with a spatula, until bread is golden and cheese fully melts.
6. For extra crispiness, spread a thin layer of mayo on the outside before grilling instead of butter.
7. Slice in half and serve hot.

defaultRecipes.title: Pho Ga
defaultRecipes.description: Light chicken broth with rice noodles and herbs.
defaultRecipes.instructions:
1. Char onion and ginger; simmer with chicken, star anise, and cinnamon to make broth; skim.
2. Remove chicken when done; shred; season broth with fish sauce and salt.
3. Soak/cook rice noodles per package; drain.
4. Assemble bowls with noodles, shredded chicken, and hot broth.
5. Top with scallions and cilantro; serve with lime and chili.
